storyInfo: Hoederer still chooses to leave Babel. After bidding farewell to Kal'tsit, the two veterans talk on their way out, and W, who remained there, works hard to win the king's approval.

attributes.content: You’ve decided.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Sounds like you aren’t asking, Dr. Kal'tsit... Sorry, I just realized, I’m supposed to call you Lord Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: There’s no point in talking about that now.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I just want to express my disappointment at your decision. You could have been a great help to Theresa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Her Majesty... came to me alone, after the last mission.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sounds like her.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She said she remembered me, where I came from, in Kazdel.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The huge industrial district, and the endless rotten, crime-ridden city of death that stretches out around it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The influx of refugees growing the slums up skyward.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: How many 'nobles' do you think there are in Kazdel? How many of them are Sarkaz who gave themselves some stupid title in an even stupider war?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: As many as there are weeds in a garden.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That’s a good one. They are like weeds.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But Her Majesty might remember.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I appreciate her kindness. She remembers the last bit of humanity left in the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: She’s the only one who could.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So why are you trying to escape?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Put it a little rougher, why don’t you, Doctor?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Ines, Dr. Kal'tsit has done a lot for us. You know that.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No offense intended.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you’ve decided to leave, I have no right to stop you. You can go and be free, travel the world as mercenaries.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You don’t need me to tell you that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But what about the other Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: W has her own plans.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And it’s not like we have the power to make every mercenary follow the rules.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: That’s how mercenaries are. It’s a lot harder to keep order with these free spirits than with big standing armies.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But some lost Sarkaz warriors could stand to learn from you... that which you seek.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Regardless, you’ve chosen your path.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if it’s a dead end.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Us mercenaries only know how to dive into war, to hide ourselves in the smoke from its wake of ruin.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I hope that works out for you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...There are barely any Sarkaz still following us.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: A lot of them decided to stay, but there’s even more who don’t get to pick where home is anymore.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The camp’s gone. The only equipment left is the bottom of the barrel stuff Babel left us.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We’re more like campers going mountain climbing than mercenaries at this point...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...It’s always been like that, all the way back to when we first met in that birch grove and decided to carve our own path.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Good thing Dr. Kal’tsit gave us a few special contracts. At least we’ll be able to get by.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: If we’re still going to be running errands for her, what difference does it make whether we leave Babel or not?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We’re just a team of mercenaries fighting to make a profit, taking a lucrative contract.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You’re lying to yourself.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...Wait, where’s our flag?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I kept it. And everything else. If I’m gonna lie to myself, might as well be thorough about it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You remember right? Back then, whenever a standard-bearer fell, another would always step up right away.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: From the west to the east, becoming a mercenary, then all the way back here. That whole time, this flag never fell.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Up until the 70th, or maybe 80th standard-bearer died. He impaled his own abdomen with the flagpole to keep it up.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: When we were escorting the Rhodes Island landship, those enemies... those monsters from Kazdel, shredded our lines like paper.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: When that happened, it was just a kid holding the flag.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The enemy had the high ground. Arts rained down around us like a mudslide.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Before Dr. Kal'tsit arrived, there was pretty much nothing we could do to fight back.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The flags are all in tatters.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But I’ve still got hands. I can hold up a flagpole.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I never liked flying a merc flag.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It should’ve been stomped into the mud a long time ago.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: How many vets from the old days are still alive?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You, and me.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...Let’s not waste any more time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hey, Hoederer.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Did you leave W with Her Majesty on purpose?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What do you think about Her Majesty? And Kal'tsit? And especially... that 'Doctor?'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Never took you for the gossipy type.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Just making small talk.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You didn’t use your Arts once the whole time you were there. That’s not like you. I was worried maybe—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I didn’t have the guts. Not with the way Dr. Kal'tsit was looking at me.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She’s an unknown quantity.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Right, better not dig too deep. Just knowing who that Kal'tsit is...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But, I might’ve accidentally taken a peek at Her Majesty. My Arts can’t look directly into peoples’ minds. More like I can get a feel for them by looking over their 'shadows'...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Her Majesty is very special.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She’s... tragic. But extremely resilient, and gentle.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit is strange. She has this almost mechanical feel to her, but like a machine, how can I put it? Full of humanity.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...You’re talking about Kal’tsit?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You can’t feel it, can you?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She sees us all as equals. She didn’t call us 'devils.'
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Maybe just because Her Majesty was there.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What about the one they just call 'The Doctor?'
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...Let’s put it like this: the soldiers are the pawns in the game. The commander is the player.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: When I saw the Doctor, I was struck with the feeling that I’m always gonna be a pawn.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That one’s not a battlefield commander. The Doctor runs the whole war.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: That’s not why.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Do you know what the biggest difference is between the piece and the player?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No... But why are you talking like W now? You were always impatient. Never heard you talking in riddles like this before.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: A chess player’s main focus is never on the pieces, or even the game. It’s always on the other player. You always want to beat an even match.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: After a win, the player goes home to a nice, hot meal. The pieces get popped back into the box and stashed away.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The player gets to sleep, wake up, walk, and talk.  The pieces just sit there in the cupboard.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We’re all objects. Inanimate objects. There was only one person, one thing really alive on that battlefield. And it was that one.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: If we’re still gonna call ourselves people, then, well... the Doctor’s something else.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Okay then. I think it’s safe to say we agree on that one.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But it looks like Her Majesty, Kal’tsit, and whoever else don’t really mind.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Dr. Kal’tsit’s always been careful. And even though we weren’t working together for very long, I got the impression their troops are kind of in the dark about it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I told W: some things are already starting to change.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...Leaving might be the right call.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Wait, you still didn’t answer my question. If we’re on the same page, why’d you leave W there then?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Are you worried about her?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So what if I am? Answer me already.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...For insurance. Just in case one day, we have to switch sides.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Or do you think the Regent, Her Majesty’s brother, will open his heart, say 'all is forgiven,' and keep letting us raid the Lateranos?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I want to get away from this war. I’m sick of fighting our own people... and we’ve already suffered enough.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Don’t get me wrong, W buying us some insurance wasn’t the original plan...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But her face lit up when I told her she could stay...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Tch... What an ingrate.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You’ve taken to our work unexpectedly quickly.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: And that goes for your two friends as well. Though they didn’t accept the Doctor’s invitation to stay, they still performed their work admirably.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Uh-huh. So, did Theresa say anything?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...If you seek Her Majesty’s praise, you may petition for an audience with her yourself.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Assuming that you can avoid Ms. Kal'tsit, that is.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: There goes that idea. That bitch is stuck to Theresa like glue. Tch, what a headache.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Anyway, where are they now?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: And yet you still intend to seek her out?
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: I just want to go take a look. Can’t get chewed out for doing that, right?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Now who’s the bigger headache?
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Hey, I worked my ass off to dig out seven spies stuck in with your refugees. Seven! And a caster too! Do you know how hard that was?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Keep it down. Your presence, as well as the details of your mission are both confidential... Shh.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: That was your job, and if I recall correctly, the Doctor asked you to keep at least one alive.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Yeah, the 'alive' part is trickier than you’d think. Guy offed himself before I could even murk him. What’s a girl supposed to do?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...*Sigh*.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: They’re on the bridge. Amiya should be there too.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: You talk like I remember all these names. As if I care.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That’s your business...
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: ...Just a moment, what’s that in your hand?
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Oh, this? A little camera that I yoinked from one of the spies. Pretty rare, huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Don’t tell me you’re going to...
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: What? Is a Sarkaz gonna pass up an opportunity to get a selfie with Her Majesty?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...Well, if Ms. Kal'tsit apprehends you as a spy, don’t expect me to bail you out.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Sure, sure.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: How’d those spies manage to get in here anyway?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Don’t you think... we’ve been going at our fights kinda weird lately?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That’s not an area where you or I should be pointing fingers. If you’re dissatisfied, take it up with the Doctor.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The Doctor, huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Maybe next time then.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (Over there? Sure enough, of that’s all of them. I’m gonna lie low for a sec.)
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (What’s with the tiny bunny? The little shit’s ears are blocking Theresa!)
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (Uh oh! Kal'tsit...)
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (...She’s not coming over here? Did she not see me?)
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (Damnit, what’s the Doctor doing here? Get that one in my picture and it’s 100% cursed...)
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (Aww, Theresa’s laughing.)
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: (Screw it, I won’t get another opportunity like this!)
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Cheese—!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...W, do you even know what’s going on right now?
Uhh, probably better than you do? I’m the one actually down on the battlefield putting in work, 'Dr. K'~
It’s fine, Kal'tsit. There’s no need to be angry—
Ugh, what a bitch... All that over a stupid picture!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But you might not like the next job so much, Mr. Captive.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Mmmf! Nnnngh...!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Captive

attributes.content: C’mon, don’t be so nervous. You brave enough to get so close to the Speaker’s Office. Surely you came prepared to have your cover blown?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: And I’m in a pretty bad mood, so you’re not gonna have a good time.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hm? Trying to off yourself?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Don’t rush it. We’re not ready for that. Not until I ask you some questions first. Now what was it...?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What happened at the Battle of the Mill last month?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What reason do you have to be here? Why are you so close to the capital?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What are you after? Who do you answer to? What were you trying to give Theresis?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Oh, take your time, no need to knee-jerk me an answer here.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What I really want to know is, say there’s an Originium needle hovering by that eye you can’t close. If I was to slowly push it in at a speed of three millimeters per second—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Would you be afraid?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hoederer’s prediction was correct. The war is starting to change.
But to be honest, I lost interest in watching the situation in Kazdel unfold... Not like it affects me, anyway.
I’m just worried... about Theresa.
Even though seeing that damned woman is about as revolting as seeing my reflection smiling back at me in the mirror, maybe I do have to talk to her.
She and I are the same kind of person. If she can even be considered a 'person,' that is. That’s one of a whole bunch of mysteries floating around her.
But she’s much stronger than me. Maybe she will be able to protect Theresa—
No, she has to.
Otherwise—–
